title: Why an NBA star's response to a reporter's question about losing hit a nerve
description: The Bucks star was prompted on whether he considered his past season a "failure" after an unexpected playoffs loss. His perspective has been praised around the league and beyond.

title: A Florida principal who was fired after showing students 'David' is welcomed in Italy
description: Among those who were in support of the ousted Florida principal was the director of Florence's Accademia Galleria, where Michelangelo's David is housed. On Friday, the two finally got to meet.

title: How South Africa nearly descended into civil war instead of a multi-racial democracy
description: Journalist Justice Malala explains how Nelson Mandela and F. W. de Klerk kept the country on a path to peace after the 1993 assassination of Chris Hani. His book is The Plot to Save South Africa.

title: Montana Rep. Zooey Zephyr sues over her removal from House floor
description: Zephyr was silenced and barred for chiding her Republican colleagues over legislation to restrict gender-affirming health care and for encouraging protesters.

title: The guy who ate a $120,000 banana in an art museum says he was just hungry
description: The banana installation by artist Maurizio Cattelan evokes everything from slapstick comedy to global trade. But to a college student, it was a reminder of how very hungry he was.

title: Arkansas woman pleads not guilty to selling over 20 boxes of stolen human body parts
description: She was hired to cremate medical cadavers. But first, she harvested organs, skin and genitalia and sold them to a man she met through a Facebook group called Oddities, according to court documents.

title: A decoder that uses brain scans to know what you mean — mostly
description: Scientists have decoded streams of words in the brain using artificial intelligence and the data from MRI scans.

title: Latest on Ukraine: May Day's another war day as Russia strikes Ukrainian cities
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: In graphic memoir 'In Limbo,' a Korean American finds healing and humanity
description: Deb J.J. Lee's debut YA graphic memoir focuses on the author's struggles with mental health and their relationships with their family and friends during their childhood and teenage years.

title: Norway unveils a life-size sculpture of Freya, the euthanized walrus
description: Freya became a global celebrity last year after she was seen frolicking and basking in a Oslo fjord before she was euthanized by the authorities. A bronze sculpture now honors her in Norway's capital.

title: Supreme Court justices need a strong code of ethics, Sen. Hirono says
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Democratic Sen. Maizie Hirono of Hawaii about the Senate Judiciary Committee's hearings on ethics reforms and the Supreme Court. Chief Justice Roberts declined to testify.

title: The Senate holds its Supreme Court ethics hearing this week — with no justices
description: Ahead of the Senate Judiciary Committee's hearing on Supreme Court ethics reform, Democratic Sen. Mazie Hirono tells NPR that the highest court in the U.S. should have the highest ethical standards.

title: 'I'll lose my family.' A husband's dread during an abortion ordeal in Oklahoma
description: Jaci and Dustin Statton didn't think Oklahoma's abortion bans would affect them. They were open to having more kids. They didn't imagine Jaci would face a life-threatening pregnancy, though.

title: Tracking the impact of U.S.-China tensions on global financial institutions
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks the president of a China-led development bank about the impact of the friction between the U.S. and China.

title: Failed bank First Republic is bought by JPMorgan Chase
description: JPMorgan Chase is buying the troubled First Republic Bank's deposits, a "substantial amount of their assets and certain liabilities," JPMorgan Chase said in a press release Monday.

title: Paraguay's long-ruling party scores an easy presidential election win
description: The Colorado Party remained the dominant force of Paraguayan politics as the vote count from Sunday's election gave an overwhelming lead to its presidential candidate, Santiago Peña.

title: Basketball legend Larry 'Gator' Rivers, longtime Globetrotter, has died at 73
description: Rivers, who helped integrate high school basketball in Georgia before playing for the Harlem Globetrotters and becoming a county commissioner in his native Savannah, died on Saturday.

title: 'Succession' season 4, episode 6: 'Living+'
description: The Waystar Royco team travels to L.A., where Kendall pitches eternal life (kind of), Shiv reconnects with the most unlikely of men, and Roman can't stop firing women.
